com.github.breadmoirai.breadbot.framework.command

Interface CommandPreprocessorFunction

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CommandPreprocessorPredicate
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommandPreprocessor
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface CommandPreprocessorFunction
    This functional interface is ran before the command is executed.

    REFER HERE

    An example implementation is shown as follows 

    
     (commandObj, targetHandle, event, processorStack) -> {
         //examples of criteria
         if (commandObj.getClass().getName().startsWith("com.github.breadmoirai.bot.commands.misc")) {
             event.reply("this command is from the misc package");
         }
         if (targetHandle.getGroup().equals("misc")) {
             event.reply("this command is from the misc group");
         }
         if (event.getMember().getColor().equals(Color.GREEN)) {
             event.reply("you are green");
         }

         if (ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextBoolean()) {
             //this next line will run the next preprocessor or the command if no preprocessors are left
             processorStack.runNext();
         }
     }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void process(java.lang.Object commandObj, CommandHandle targetHandle, CommandEvent event, CommandProcessStack processorStack)
      This method is ran before the command is executed.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        void process(java.lang.Object commandObj,
             CommandHandle targetHandle,
             CommandEvent event,
             CommandProcessStack processorStack)
        This method is ran before the command is executed. If you wish to continue the execution of the command, simply use the Runnable passed and call Runnable#run() to trigger the next preprocessor or the activation of the command. Calling the passed Runnable again after the first invocation will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        commandObj - The command object that will be used to call the commandHandle.
        targetHandle - The targetHandle. This is whatever the annotation was attached to.
        event - the event that triggered things
        processorStack - A queue of Runnables that represent any other preprocessors and the last element being the command itself. Failure to call processQueue.continue() will result in the command not being activated.
